shortdesc.ph: Stops media stream relay across channels.
Stops media stream relay across channels.

section.p: Call this method to stop media stream relay across channels. Once the relay stops, the host leaves all destination channels.
Call this method to stop media stream relay across channels. Once stopped, the broadcaster exits all destination channels.
section.note: If the method call fails, the SDK triggers the callback and returns the status code RELAY_ERROR_SERVER_NO_RESPONSE (2) or RELAY_ERROR_SERVER_CONNECTION_LOST (8). You can also call the leaveChannel method to leave the channel, and the media stream relay across channels stops automatically.

If the method call fails, the SDK reports RELAY_ERROR_SERVER_NO_RESPONSE (2) or RELAY_ERROR_SERVER_CONNECTION_LOST (8) via the callback. You can call leaveChannel to leave the channel, and the media stream relay will stop automatically.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: This method is applicable in multi-channel scenarios.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p: After this method is successfully called, the SDK triggers the callback. If the callback returns RELAY_STATE_IDLE (0) and RELAY_OK (0), it indicates that the host has successfully stopped the relay.

-5: Call rejected. No ongoing media stream relay across channels.
